title: Postpartum bleeding
summary: Postpartum bleeding or postpartum hemorrhage (PPH) is often defined as the loss of more than 500 ml or 1,000 ml of blood within the first 24 hours following childbirth.[2] Some have added the requirement that there also be signs or symptoms of low blood volume for the condition to exist.[6] Signs and symptoms may initially include: an increased heart rate, feeling faint upon standing, and an increased breathing rate.[1] As more blood is lost, the patient may feel cold, blood pressure may drop, and they may become restless or unconscious.[1] The condition can occur up to six weeks following delivery.[6]
